key_title: Key to the species of Westringia

source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Salvia
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria Vol. 4 Dicotyledons Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Conn, B.J. (1999). Salvia. In: Walsh, N.G, Entwisle, T.J., Flora of Victoria Vol. 4 Dicotyledons Cornaceae to Asteraceae, pp. 428-430. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves in whorls of 5 or 6, crowded together (internodes short), alpine to subalpine plant of eastern Victoria
Leaves in whorls of 3 or 4, sometimes opposite
Leaves less than 2.5 mm wide, usually scabrous, margin recurved to strongly revolute

Leaves at least 2.5 mm wide, glabrous or almost so, margin not or only slightly recurved (lamina c. flat, often slightly incurved), or if leaves less than 2.5 mm wide then margin never recurved (in W. crassifolia and W. longifolia)
Calyx-lobes less than half as long as tube; leaves sessile, rigid; flowers white; intricate or divaricate shrub of mallee communities
Calyx-lobes usually at least half as long as tube; leaves with petiole 0.3–2 mm long (rarely sessile), c. soft-textured; flowers mostly c. mauve
Spreading shrub to c. 0.5 m high; calyx-lobes 0.6–0.7 times length of tube; corolla c. 10 mm long; endemic in Snowy River gorge area
Slender, erect shrub with suberect to spreading branches to 2 m high; calyx-lobes 0.3–1.3 (–1.7) times length of tube; corolla 6.5–8.5 mm long; scattered from mallee areas to far east
Leaf broad-oblong to -elliptic or subcircular, 1.3–1.8 times as long as wide; calyx- lobes (0.3–) 0.6 times tube; shrub of subalpine areas
Leaf narrow, linear, ovate, elliptic to slightly oblong, 3–18 times as long as wide; shrubs of lower altitudes
Calyx-lobes triangular to narrowly triangular, 3–3.7 mm long; leaf narrowly ovate to narrowly elliptic, 3–4 (–11) mm wide
Calyx-lobes triangular, 1.5–2.8 mm long; leaf linear or narrowly elliptic to slightly oblong,1–2.5 mm wide
Calyx with outer surface moderately to densely hairy; leaves narrowly elliptic to slightly oblong, 5–15 mm long, length-to-width ratio 3–6; corolla 12–14 mm long
Calyx with outer surface sparsely hairy to glabrescent, rarely moderately hairy; leaves linear, 12–35 mm long, length-to-width ratio 10–18; corolla 8–10 mm long
